definitions.text: the act of applying force to propel something
examples: after reaching the desired velocity the drive is cut off

definitions.text: a mechanism by which force or power is transmitted in a machine
examples: a variable speed drive permitted operation through a range of speeds

definitions.text: a series of actions advancing a principle or tending toward a particular end
examples: he supported populist campaigns
they worked in the cause of world peace
the team was ready for a drive toward the pennant
the movement to end slavery
contributed to the war effort

definitions.text: a road leading up to a private house
examples: they parked in the driveway

definitions.text: the trait of being highly motivated
examples: his drive and energy exhausted his co-workers

definitions.text: hitting a golf ball off of a tee with a driver
examples: he sliced his drive out of bounds

definitions.text: the act of driving a herd of animals overland
a journey in a vehicle (usually an automobile)
examples: he took the family for a drive in his new car

definitions.text: a physiological state corresponding to a strong need or desire
(computer science) a device that writes data onto or reads data from a storage medium
a wide scenic road planted with trees
examples: the riverside drive offers many exciting scenic views

definitions.text: (sports) a hard straight return (as in tennis or squash)
operate or control a vehicle
examples: drive a car or bus
Can you drive this four-wheel truck?

definitions.text: travel or be transported in a vehicle
examples: We drove to the university every morning
They motored to London for the theater

definitions.text: cause someone or something to move by driving
examples: She drove me to school every day
We drove the car to the garage

definitions.text: force into or from an action or state, either physically or metaphorically
examples: She rammed her mind into focus
He drives me mad

definitions.text: to compel or force or urge relentlessly or exert coercive pressure on, or motivate strongly
examples: She is driven by her passion

definitions.text: cause to move back by force or influence
examples: repel the enemy
push back the urge to smoke
beat back the invaders

definitions.text: compel somebody to do something, often against his own will or judgment
examples: She finally drove him to change jobs

definitions.text: push, propel, or press with force
examples: Drive a nail into the wall

definitions.text: cause to move rapidly by striking or throwing with force
examples: drive the ball far out into the field

definitions.text: strive and make an effort to reach a goal
examples: She tugged for years to make a decent living
We have to push a little to make the deadline!
She is driving away at her doctoral thesis

definitions.text: move into a desired direction of discourse
examples: What are you driving at?

definitions.text: have certain properties when driven
examples: This car rides smoothly
My new truck drives well

definitions.text: work as a driver
examples: He drives a bread truck
She drives for the taxi company in Newark

definitions.text: move by being propelled by a force
examples: The car drove around the corner

definitions.text: urge forward
examples: drive the cows into the barn

definitions.text: proceed along in a vehicle
examples: We drive the turnpike to work

definitions.text: strike with a driver, as in teeing off
examples: drive a golf ball

definitions.text: hit very hard, as by swinging a bat horizontally
examples: drive a ball

definitions.text: excavate horizontally
examples: drive a tunnel

definitions.text: cause to function by supplying the force or power for or by controlling
examples: The amplifier drives the tube
steam drives the engines
this device drives the disks for the computer

definitions.text: hunting: search for game
examples: drive the forest

definitions.text: hunting: chase from cover into more open ground
examples: drive the game
